NAME: Kostomuksha
CEDS_COMMENT: Iron ore dressing mill

NAME: Mildred Lake
CEDS_COMMENT: No emissions in 1B2 in Canada

NAME: Novopolotsk
CEDS_COMMENT: Novopolotsk does have an oil refinery, which is why this may have ended up in 'Oil and Gas'. However in CEDS, majority of emissions associated with heat production, and then elec production. Almost no emissions attributed to 1B2. There is also a power plant, as commented, which uses oil and gas! But then this should be in 1A1a.

NAME: Magnitogorsk
CEDS_COMMENT: Steel plant

NAME: Orenburg
COMMENT: Gas refinery, power plant within 20 km

NAME: Mariupol
CEDS_COMMENT: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Azovstal_Iron_and_Steel_Works

NAME: Astrakhan
COMMENT: Gas refinery, power plant within 20 km

NAME: Mubarek
COMMENT: Mubarec gap processing plant, other oil and gas industrial sources
CEDS_COMMENT: Large gas plant. Lines up with CEDS emissions in UZB being 1B2b_Fugitive-NG-prod

NAME: Aliaga Kardemir
COMMENT: Aliaga Kardemir refinery and power plant
CEDS_COMMENT: Near-zero emissions in 1B2 sector in Turkey, lots in energy production. Possible the coal fired plant, and the coking refinery: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kardemir_power_station and https://www.offshore-technology.com/marketdata/aliaga-refinery-coking-turkey/?cf-view

NAME: Khangiran
CEDS_COMMENT: In Iran, the large majority of emissions in CEDS come from 1B2, and thus is our default labeling in Iran. There are other sectors that contribute non-insignfigant emissions which we would consider further.

NAME: Zagroz
CEDS_COMMENT: Massive complex of petrochemical plants. Includes and oil refinery in the area. Again, could probably be included in multiple, though mostly seems like 2B_Chemical-Industry, which Iran has some emissions in this sector in CEDS

NAME: Linhai
CEDS_COMMENT: Chemical processing plants in the area. CEDS in Taiwan has near zero 1B2 emissions, but significant 1A2c_Ind-Comb-Chemicals

NAME: Manchester
COMMENT: Bauxite plants. May not be correct position of the source.

NAME: Tacoa
CEDS_COMMENT: Appears to actually be a heavy oil power plant (http://www.hpi-llc.com/expertise/turnkey-power-plants/epc-projects/tacoa-power-barge) (https://www.industrialfireworld.com/540292/tacoa-venezuela-dec-19-1982)

NAME: Sergipe
COMMENT: Sergipe Oil Field. Very weak signal, just above the sensitivity level.
CEDS_COMMENT: No emissions in 1B2 in Brazil

NAME: Noranda
CEDS_COMMENT: Copper, zinc, nickel mines and smelter. More recently alumninum smelting took over. Perhaps for recent years, like OMI years, should be 2C3. However, all emissions in Chile in CEDS are in 2C4, NF metals (https://www.referenceforbusiness.com/history2/44/Noranda-Inc.html)

NAME: Rudny
CEDS_COMMENT: Most emissions are in this sector

NAME: Zhenhai
CEDS_COMMENT: In China, next to no emisisons in 1B2. Lots in 2B_Chem-ind and 1A2c_Ind-Comb-Chemicals. Here default chem processes to 2B

NAME: Qingzhen
COMMENT: Multiple sources near Qingzhen. Strong and significant signal, but not sure about the exact source type and location.
CEDS_COMMENT: Lots of bauxite mines and aluminum processing/smelters in the area. (see here https://www.asianmetal.cn/news/data/2135962/ and https://www.cmgroup.net/news/guizhou-qingzhen-bx-mining-capacity-5-mtpy/)

NAME: Jilin
CEDS_COMMENT: In China, next to no emisisons in 1B2. Lots in 2B_Chem-ind and 1A2c_Ind-Comb-Chemicals. Here default chem processes to 2B

NAME: Jinzhou
CEDS_COMMENT: In China, next to no emisisons in 1B2. Lots in 2B_Chem-ind and 1A2c_Ind-Comb-Chemicals. Here default chem processes to 2B

NAME: Maoming
CEDS_COMMENT: Multiple cement factories, oil farms and other petrochemical complexes in the area. Default to 2B, though could belong in multiple sectors.

NAME: Xiashan
CEDS_COMMENT: Multiple chemical/petrochemical plants in the area

NAME: Chovar
CEDS_COMMENT: Petrochemical plant creating mostly HDPE plastics

NAME: Kryvyi Rih
CEDS_COMMENT: Central Mining and Processing Plant (Central GOK) produces 67.5% and 68.2% Fe concentrate and 65% Fe pellets

NAME: Zestafoni
CEDS_COMMENT: Appears to be refrencing mining operation (https://mmi.ge/10247-history-of-development-of-metallurgy-in-georgia.html). In CEDS, mining emissions in Georgia are zero. Instead, they appear in `other`

NAME: Yangjiazhangzi
CEDS_COMMENT: Known for its mines being a major supplier of the worlds Molybdenum

NAME: Sovetabad
CEDS_COMMENT: Gas Field (https://scholarship.rice.edu/bitstream/handle/1911/91496/%20international-gas-trade-in-central-asia-turkmenistan-iran-russia-and-afghanistan.pdf?sequence=1)

NAME: Dakhni
CEDS_COMMENT: No emissions in 1B2 in Pakistan, but available in 1A1bc

NAME: Khouzestan
CEDS_COMMENT: Iran has very little emissions in this sector in CEDS. Assume heavy oil, but could also be some diesel.

NAME: Zarand
CEDS_COMMENT: Iran has very little emissions in this sector in CEDS. Assume heavy oil, but could also be some diesel.

NAME: Edmonton
CEDS_COMMENT: No emissions in 1B2 in Canada

NAME: Sangan
CEDS_COMMENT: Limited energy data detail, most emissions are in 1A2g_Ind-Comb-other

NAME: Abreu
CEDS_COMMENT: No emissions in 1B2 in Brazil

NAME: Duke
CEDS_COMMENT: No emissions in 1B2 in Brazil

NAME: Santos
CEDS_COMMENT: No emissions in 1B2 in Brazil

NAME: Triumph
CEDS_COMMENT: No emissions in 1B2 in Brazil

NAME: Saman-Depe
CEDS_COMMENT: Gas Field https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saman-Depe_Gas_Field#:~:text=Saman%2DDepe%20is%20proven%20to,drilled%20by%20subcontractor%20Sichuan%20Petroleum.

NAME: Golgohar
CEDS_COMMENT: Iran has very little emissions in this sector in CEDS. Assume heavy oil, but could also be some diesel.

NAME: Zarinshahr
CEDS_COMMENT: Iran has very little emissions in this sector in CEDS. Assume heavy oil, but could also be some diesel.
